question: A 25-year-old female presents with sudden onset pain in the right upper limb on examination right upper limb is pale, cold, extremely tender with absent radial and brachial pulses on the right side. What is the likely diagnosis?
A 25-year-old female with a history of two miscarriages develops deep vein thrombosis (DVT) in her leg. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old man was rushed to the emergency department after an accidental fall from a motorbike. He was bleeding profusely and was examined for possible fractures and his x-ray report shows a fracture of the femur and the tibia. What kind of anemia is he at risk of?

A 25-year-old patient came to the outpatient department for her antenatal checkup. On examination she was pale. A complete blood picture reveals Hb 9 gm/dl with a hypochromic, microcytic picture. Which of the following statements is correct regarding the condition she is having?

answers.option: Check for family history of similar disease

question: A 25-year-old woman complains of fatigue and weakness. On physical examination, she appears pale. Laboratory studies show a total RBC count of 4.7 million/mm³, hemoglobin of 10.5 g/dL, hematocrit of 37.1%, platelet count of 217,000/mm³, and WBC count of 5890/mm³. The peripheral blood smear shows hypochromic and microcytic RBCs. Total serum iron and ferritin levels are normal. Hemoglobin electrophoresis shows an elevated hemoglobin A2 level of about 5.8%. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 26-year-old woman comes to the outpatient clinic with complaints of rapid heart rate and easy fatigability. Laboratory workup reveals low hemoglobin and microcytic red cell size. Which of the following is the most suitable therapy?

A 27-year-old, previously healthy man has experienced malaise, low-grade fever, and sore throat for 2 weeks. On physical examination, his temperature is 37.6°C, and he has pharyngitis. On examination, there is tender cervical, axillary, and inguinal lymphadenopathy. Complete blood count shows hemoglobin 12.2 g/dl, hematocrit 36.6%, platelet count 190,200/mm³, and WBC count 8,940/mm³. The peripheral blood smear showed atypical lymphocytes. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 28-year-old male gave a history of laparotomy due to intestinal perforation 1 month back, his mobility was reduced due to this condition and now he has developed right leg swelling and pain up to mid-thigh for the last 1 week which is progressing gradually. What will be the duration of anticoagulation in this patient?

A 29-year-old woman has had malaise and a low-grade fever for the past week. On physical examination, she appears very pale. She has a history of chronic anemia, and spherocytes are observed on a peripheral blood smear. Her hematocrit, which normally ranges from 35% to 38%, is now 28%, and the reticulocyte count is very low (indicative of bone marrow suppression). The serum bilirubin level is 0.9 mg/dL. Which of the following events is most likely to have occurred in this patient?

answers.option: Accelerated extravascular hemolysis in the spleen

question: A 3-year-old boy is brought to the outpatient department with the complaint of bruises all over his body for the past 2 days. He is otherwise active and playful. Physical examination is unremarkable. Complete blood count shows the total count of platelet at 20,000. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 3-year-old boy presents with poor appetite and is underweight for his age and height. Physical examination shows hepatosplenomegaly. The hemoglobin concentration is 6 g/dl, and the peripheral blood smear shows severely hypochromic, microcytic RBCs and poikilocytosis. The total serum iron level is normal, and the reticulocyte count is 10%. A radiograph of the hand shows maxillofacial deformities and expanded marrow spaces. Which of the following conditions is the most likely cause of this child’s illness?

answers.option: Sequestration of iron in reticuloendothelial cells
Imbalance in the production of alpha and beta globin chains

question: A 3-year-old child was brought to the emergency department with accidental administration of iron tablets. Which of the following drugs can be used as an iron-chelating agent in iron poisoning?

A 30-year-old female admitted with anemic failure for which she received six units of stored whole blood. After 24 hours she develops twitching on the face and carpopedal spasm of hands. What is the best treatment option?

answers.option: Give her I/V slowly calcium gluconate infusion

question: A 30-year-old female with no known comorbidity comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of left lower limb swelling and redness for the last 15 days. She gives a history of multiple second-trimester miscarriages. What is the investigation of choice for this patient?
A 30-year-old lady received 6 units of blood and developed carpopedal spasm and twitching in her hands, along with flushing of the face. What can be given to relieve her condition?

A 32-year-old male came to the outpatient department complaining of fever, fatigue, weakness, weight loss, and night sweats. His blood report shows Hb: 9mg/dl, WBC: 82x 10E9, and platelets: 84x 10E9. Peripheral film review showed 69% blast cells. The patient was advised of bone marrow aspirate, trephine biopsy, and cytogenetics testing. In leukemic presentations, one of the following cells replaces the normal bone marrow cells to make it hypercellular?

A 32-year-old woman delivered her second child two weeks ago. She has been feeling unusually tired and noticed some bruising on her arms and legs along with small red spots on her chest. She reports having episodes of headaches and confusion. CBC shows hemoglobin of 11.2 g/dl, WBC count of 9.9x10^9/L, and a platelet count of 32,000x9/L. The peripheral blood smear shows schistocytes. The serum nitrogen level is 38 mg/dL and her creatinine level is 3.9 mg/dl. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 32-year-old woman presented to the clinic with complaints of jaundice, fatigue, and dark-colored urine. Urine analysis was positive for hemosiderinuria and the flow cytometry results were negative for CD55 and CD59. Based on these findings, which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old male known case of chronic myeloid leukemia shows massive splenomegaly on clinical examination. Complete blood count (CBC) reveals WBC count=165x10^9/L, Hb= 9.0 gm/dL and platelets=510 X10^3. Which of the following targeted therapy is specific for chronic myeloid leukemia patients?
A 35-year-old man presents to the clinic with easy fatigability and weakness. Spherocytes can be seen on peripheral blood smear. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 35-year-old man with a history of intravenous drug abuse has generalized lymphadenopathy. Which of the following tests would help in finding the cause of his lymphadenopathy?

A 36-year-old female with no known comorbidity comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of progressive right leg swelling, pain, and redness for the past 15 days. She also has a history of multiple 2nd-trimester miscarriages. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 36-year-old man presents with tingling and neuropathic pain in his feet. Blood test reveals macrocytic anemia. Which of the following drugs will probably be required in this case?

A 38-year-old female comes to the outpatient department with the complaint of easy bruisability, gum bleeding, and menorrhagia. The examination was unremarkable except for pallor. Lab reports show Hb at 6.5 g/dl, Total leukocyte count at 7.8/ cmm, and platelet count at 10,000 cmm, also reports are negative for antinuclear antibodies. Which of the following can be diagnosis for this patient?
A 4-year-old boy has a form of microcytic, hypochromic anemia. His skull X-ray shows a crew-cut appearance. Which form of thalassemia is most likely in this patient?

A 4-year-old boy is brought to the emergency room with a painful swollen right knee. The parents give a history of mild trauma, with the child falling from standing height. The knee is visibly swollen, bluish in color and movement is restricted due to pain. The parents also report a history of prolonged bleeding following his circumcision. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 4-year-old girl presents with skin pallor for the past 3 days. One week ago she had a history of bloody diarrhea. Examination showed petechiae on the upper limbs. Laboratory studies revealed Hb 7.1 g/dl, reticulocytes 14%, platelets 30x 109/L, and normal WBC count. The renal function is deranged. The peripheral smear features numerous schistocytes and occasional nucleated RBC. Given the findings, which of the following bacteria is involved in the pathophysiology of disease?

A 40-year-old male bed-bound from paraplegia is diagnosed with deep vein thrombosis (DVT) in his right leg. He develops a sudden onset of shortness of breath. A subsequent diagnosis of pulmonary embolism is made. What will be the most common initial electrocardiography (ECG) finding?

A 40-year-old male, a diagnosed case of liver cirrhosis due to hepatitis C, is admitted to the medical ward with a history of hematemesis. Investigations show CBC: Hb 7 g/dL, WBC 8.2x10^9/L, platelets 52x10^9, prothrombin time 20 s (control 11 s). Which of the following factors is not assessed by prothrombin time?

A 45-year-old female with chronic hypertension presents to the outpatient department with petechial rashes. Laboratory shows platelet counts of 50,000. The prothrombin time (PT) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) are both in a normal range. However, the bleeding time is elevated. Which of the following is the cause of her condition?

A 45-year-old male patient presents to the outpatient department with painless lymphadenopathy in the neck and axilla. He also reports experiencing night sweats, and unexplained weight loss for the past few weeks. On physical examination, the nodes are firm and non-tender. There is no evidence of hepatosplenomegaly. The lymph nodes are of different sizes. Which of the following can be a likely cause of his condition?

A 45-year-old man presented to the medical specialist with complaints of generalized weakness, exertional shortness of breath, and loose stools for one month. His complete blood count reveals a hemoglobin level of 7.2 g/dL with a mean corpuscular volume of 107 fl, a white blood cell count of 3800/microliter, and a platelet count of 89,000/microliter. Additionally, the peripheral blood smear indicates the presence of hypersegmented neutrophils. What are his symptoms most likely caused by?
A 45-year-old man recently had a gastrectomy. He now presents with lethargy, weakness and parasthesia of the limbs. His MCV is 110 fL. What is the likely cause of his symptoms?
A 45-year-old man with acute myocardial infarction is given alteplase. Which statement best describes its effect?

answers.option: Inhibits synthesis of vitamin K-dependent coagulation factors
Prevents aggregation of adjacent platelets by blocking glycoprotein IIb/IIIa receptor

question: A 5-year-old boy presents with fever. In the past 2 days, several large ecchymoses have appeared on the right thigh and left shoulder. CBC shows hemoglobin, 10.2 g/dL; platelet count, 45,000 x 10⁹/L; and WBC count, 13.9 x 10³/L. Examination of the peripheral blood smear shows blasts that lack peroxidase-positive granules, but contain PAS-positive granules and stain positively for deoxynucleotidyl transferase (TdT+). Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 5-year-old child with a known case of eczema also develops rhinitis and gets asthmatic with seasonal change. She is brought to the outpatient department and a complete blood count is advised. Which cell would be in high number is this case?

A 5-year-old girl is brought to the outpatient department with the complaint of recurrent episodes of epistaxis and gingival bleeding. On examination, she is pale and has bruise marks all over her body. Her lab reports show normal PT/ APTT, normal platelet count, and normal Hb levels in her body but her bleeding time is prolonged. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 50-year-old male has a flight to the USA and has started experiencing sudden pain in his left calf. What is the appropriate initial management?

A 50-year-old male presents to the clinic with persistent fatigue, weakness, recurrent infections, and ecchymosis. His laboratory investigations are as follows: hemoglobin (Hb) = 7 g/dl, platelets = 80,000/mm³, and white blood cell (WBC) = 52,000/mm³. A peripheral smear shows 83% blast cells. Which of the following features is most likely to be observed in this patient?

A 50-year-old male was diagnosed with a case of non-Hodgkin's lymphoma. His hemoglobin was 6 gm/dL. Peripheral smear shows anemia. Which type of anemia are non-Hodgkin lymphomas mostly associated with?

answers.option: Anemia due to bone marrow infiltration

question: A 50-year-old man has been experiencing persistent fatigue and a sensation of fullness in her abdomen for the past several months. Clinical and laboratory features are suggestive of chronic myeloid leukemia. Which of the following molecular tests is considered the most definitive for diagnosing chronic myeloid leukemia?

A 50-year-old man has been weak and dizzy for several months. He has a history of peptic ulcers and occasional black, tarry stools. He consumes a diet low in iron-rich foods and drinks coffee frequently. The appearance of the peripheral blood smear shows hypochromic, microcytic red blood cells. Which of the following conditions should be suspected as the most likely cause of these findings?
A 50-year-old man has large-sized red blood cells and hemoglobin is also below normal. Which of the following will he be prescribed?

A 55-year-old male has severe lumbar vertebral pain. His complete blood count shows normocytic normochromic anemia with a markedly raised erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR). The clinical diagnosis by the physician is multiple myeloma. Assuming that the clinical diagnosis is correct, what will be the most characteristic finding on the peripheral film of his peripheral smear?

A 55-year-old man felt a lump near his shoulder 1 week ago. On physical examination, there is an enlarged, non-tender, supraclavicular lymph node and an enlargement of the Waldeyer ring of oropharyngeal lymphoid tissue. There is no hepatosplenomegaly. CBC is normal except for findings of mild anemia. A lymph node biopsy specimen shows replacement by a monomorphous population of lymphoid cells that are twice the size of normal lymphocytes, with enlarged nuclei and prominent nucleoli. Immunohistochemical staining and flow cytometry of the node indicates that most lymphoid cells are CD19+, CD10+, CD3−, CD15−, and terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase negative (TdT−). A BCL6 gene mutation is present. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 6-year-old boy presents with history of fever and bloody diarrhea for the last 1 week. She has also had pallor and oliguria for one day. Laboratory findings show hemoglobin 5.5 gm/dL, TLC 6500/microlitre, platelets 30,000/mm³, and increased urea and creatinine. Peripheral smear shows target cells and schistocytes. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 6-year-old boy with loose stools develops hemolytic uremic syndrome. What is the most likely causative organism?

A 6-year-old child has been diagnosed with hereditary spherocytosis and complained of an increased frequency of blood transfusions. Blood complete picture shows Hb = 6.5 gm/dL, reticulocyte count = 20%, TLC = 4000/mm³, platelets = 100,000/mm³. What will be the most appropriate treatment in this case?

A 6-year-old child, diagnosed with hereditary spherocytosis, complained of increased frequency of blood transfusions. Blood complete picture shows Hb=6.5 gm/dL, reticulocyte count=20%, TLC=4000/mm³, platelets=100,000/mm³. What will be the most appropriate treatment for this child?

A 6-year-old girl is evaluated for anemia. Her blood report shows hemoglobin of 5g/dl with 7% reticulocyte. Her platelets and leukocytes are normal. Peripheral smear shows numerous spherocytes. Her physical examination revealed splenomegaly. Her mother also has a similar history. Based on the information given above, what diagnosis can we make?

A 60-year-old patient presented with anorexia, weakness, paraesthesia, and mental changes. His tongue was red, tendon reflexes were diminished, and hemoglobin was 6 gm/dL with large red cells and hypersegmented neutrophils. Endoscopy revealed atrophic gastritis. Deficiency of which factor is likely to be responsible for his condition?

A 61-year-old female is hospitalized for the management of hepatic encephalopathy. She is obese and not able to ambulate very far on her own. Upon discharge, the physician wants to send her home on heparin to reduce the risk of deep vein thrombosis. How does heparin work?

A 62-year-old man complains of pallor and fatigue. On physical examination, he is pale, and his spleen is palpable and the liver edge is firm. Laboratory studies show hemoglobin of 8.2 g/dl, MCV of 107 µm³, platelet count of 135,000/mm³, and WBC count of 3920/mm³. The peripheral blood smear shows prominent anisocytosis and macrocytosis. A few of the neutrophils show up to six to seven lobes. Which of the following is the most likely explanation of these findings?

answers.option: Reduced deformity of the RBC membrane
Nuclear maturation defect resulting from impaired DNA synthesis
Increased susceptibility to lysis by complement

question: A 62-year-old man has experienced vague abdominal discomfort accompanied by bloating and diarrhea for the past 6 months. On physical examination, there is a midabdominal firm mass. The stool is positive for occult blood. An abdominal CT scan shows a mass that was removed. Microscopically, the mass is composed of sheets of large lymphoid cells with large nuclei, prominent nucleoli, and frequent mitotic figures. The neoplastic cells mark with CD19+ and CD20+ and have the BCL6 gene rearrangement. Which of the following prognostic features are most applicable to this case?

answers.option: Aggressive, can be cured by chemotherapy
Aggressive, often transforms to acute leukemia
Indolent, can be cured by chemotherapy
Indolent, survival of 7 to 9 years without treatment

question: A 64-year-old male presents to the hospital with excruciating back pain, His erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) and creatinine levels are markedly raised. The clinical diagnosis made by the physician is multiple myeloma. What will be the most characteristic findings on his serum protein electrophoresis?

answers.option: Single sharp discrete band in gamma region
Polyclonal broad band in gamma region
Single sharp band in alpha region
Single sharp band in beta 2 region
Single sharp band in albumin region

question: A 65-year-old man with a known case of ischemic heart disease came to the emergency department with complaints of exertional chest pain and dyspnea for 15 days. On examination, the patient is markedly pale, and a CVS examination shows a systolic murmur. His complete blood count revealed hemoglobin of 6.5 g/dL with an MCV of 69 fl; serum iron and ferritin are low, with an increase in TIBC. What is the initial treatment option?
A 7-year-old boy develops jaundice and severe anemia after consuming fava beans. Which of the following is the cause of his condition?

A 7-year-old child presents to the outpatient department with his mother, with complaints of weight loss, fever, pallor, and bleeding over the body for three weeks. On examination, there is generalized lymphadenopathy with hepatosplenomegaly. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 70-year-old male presents to the hospital with severe backache. His investigations reveal Hb=7 gm/dl, creatinine=2 mg/dL, ESR= 110 mm/hour. What other finding is most likely to be found on investigations?

A 70-year-old man has developed widespread ecchymoses over the skin in the past month. His medical history includes a diagnosis of mucinous adenocarcinoma of the rectum with hepatic metastasis. Laboratory studies show a prothrombin time of 30 seconds, partial thromboplastin time of 55 seconds, platelet count of 15,200/mm³, fibrinogen level of 75 mg/dL, and elevated fibrin split product levels (D-dimer). Which of the following morphologic findings is most likely to be present on peripheral blood smear examination?

A 72-year-old male came to the outpatient department complaining of fever, fatigue, weakness, weight loss, and night sweats. His blood report shows Hb: 8 mg/dl, WBC: 3.5 x 10E9, and platelets: 90 x 10E9. Peripheral film review showed dysplastic neutrophils. The patient was advised of bone marrow aspirate, trephine biopsy, and cytogenetics testing. Which of the following is not the morphological feature of dysplastic syndrome?

A 72-year-old man is brought to the emergency department with sudden onset of acute arterial occlusions of the right lower limb leading to gangrene of the lower leg and foot. He has lens subluxation and a long tapering finger. What is the most probable cause of this acute arterial occlusion?
A 73-year-old man with a history of coronary disease and angina pectoris is taking aspirin and dipyridamole. What is the mechanism of action of dipyridamole?
A 75-year-old man presents to the hospital with generalized painless lymphadenopathy. Laboratory findings reveal a white blood cell count of 20,000 cells/mm³. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 77-year-old woman notices that petechiae appeared on the skin of her arms and legs over the past 3 weeks. On physical examination, she is afebrile and has no organomegaly. Laboratory studies show a normal prothrombin time and partial thromboplastin time. CBC shows hemoglobin of 12.7 g/dL, hematocrit of 37.2%, MCV of 80 μm3, platelet count of 276,000/mm3, and WBC count of 5600/mm3. Platelet function studies and fibrinogen levels are normal, and no fibrin split products are detectable. Which of the following best explains these findings?

A 9-year-old boy has had increasing pain and swelling on the right side of his face over the past 8 months. On physical examination, there is a large, non-tender mass involving the mandible, which deforms the right side of his face. There is no lymphadenopathy or splenomegaly, and he is afebrile. A biopsy of the mass is performed and microscopic examination shows intermediate-sized lymphocytes with a high mitotic rate. A chromosome analysis shows a t(8;14) karyotype in these cells. The hemoglobin concentration is 13.2 g/dL, the platelet count is 272,000/mm3, and the WBC count is 5820/mm3. Infection with which of the following viruses is most likely to be causally related to the development of these findings?

A 9-year-old boy is brought to the outpatient department after he developed prominent bruises on his extremities. There is a history of a recent viral infection. Labs show normal values of both prothrombin time (PT) and activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT). What is the most likely diagnosis?
A blood film shows hypochromic and microcytic red blood cells with poikilocytosis. What is the diagnosis based on this appearance?

A child had a history of typhoid fever for 15 days. He was given a number of antibiotics including chloramphenicol and antipyretics. His laboratory work shows neutropenia. What is the cause of the neutropenia?

answers.option: Immunological mediated injury due to Systemic lupus erythmatosis

question: A child has had a fever for 15 days. He has been taking antipyretics and antibiotics. His complete blood count report shows leukopenia and absolute neutropenia. What would be the cause of neutropenia?

A child is brought to the clinic by his parents with a complaint of fatigue. His parents further inform about their family history of blood disorder. His laboratory results show hemoglobin 9.6 mg/dL, reticulocytes 7%, and mean corpuscular volume (MCV) 87 fl. His blood smear shows the presence of spherocytes. What is the possible diagnosis?

A child is diagnosed with non-Hodgkin lymphoma. He has generalized lymphadenopathy. Chest X-ray shows a mediastinal mass and CT abdomen shows enlarged, multiple mesentric, and para aortic lymph nodes. What is the most likely stage of the disease?
A child of pubertal age alleged to have been sexually assaulted was brought to the M/L section to determine the age. Which one of the following can be the best site for the X-ray to determine age.

A child presented with the complaint of right armpit pain in the outpatient department of a hospital. On examination, the doctor noticed an abrasion on his forearm. A biopsy was suggested which revealed stellate necrotizing granuloma. Which of the following could be responsible for that?

A child presents with a bleeding disorder. According to his mother, his uncle has the same problem. He is diagnosed with hemophilia. Which of the following tests will be used to confirm the diagnosis?

A child presents with an enlarged spleen and jaundice. His laboratory findings include an increased red blood cell width, spherocytes with loss of pallor, and increased mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration (MCHC). Which of the following would be a possible diagnosis?
A child suffering from hemolytic uremic syndrome will have which one of the following finding in his peripheral blood smear?

A child with sickle cell disease has taken all preventive measures against infections and factors that can precipitate sickling but still develops complications. What should be the next best step in management?
A dead body is brought to the mortuary for post mortem examination, having post mortem rigidity present in the whole body from head to toe. What is the estimated time since the death?
A dead body is brought to the mortuary, lower limbs are stiff, while the abdomen, chest, and upper body are relaxed. How much time has passed since death?
A dead body is brought to the mortuary. On post-mortem examination, the body is cold, the muscles are rigid, and PML is fixed on the back of the body. What is the time since death?
A dead body is found with complete calcification of the third molar. Which of the following could be the age of this person before death?

A dead body of a young female is recovered from her house hanging from a fan. On examination, it is seen that post-mortem lividity has developed in the lower limbs, which blanch on pressure. If in a dead body the post-mortem lividity is fully developed but blanches on pressure, what would be the probable time since death?
A dying patient consented to a viscera transplantation after his death. When can a doctor take out the viscera for transplantation?

A female presented with gingival bleeding, fever, and headache to the outpatient department (OPD). Her lab results showed normal partial thromboplastin time (PTT) and prothrombin time (PT) but increased bleeding time. Her blood smear showed the presence of schistocytes. Which one is the most likely diagnosis?

A girl presented to the emergency with a complaint of easy bruising and petechia, which is on and off. Her brother also suffered from the same condition. The lab results of the girl showed increased bleeding and partial thromboplastin time. Which one of the following conditions was she suffering from?

A group of medical students submits the plan for their research project to the institutional board. This plan contains background, objectives, hypothesis, methodology, consent form, questionnaire, and references. Which of the following best defines this plan for research given in the above scenario?

A group of researchers write a research proposal and in it they gave an explanation of the fundamental reasons for their research. Which of the following best describes the justification of the research work?

A guy got into a road traffic accident and sustained wounds on his leg. He does not have a history of prior tetanus vaccination. After decontamination of the wound, what will the next best management?

answers.option: Tetanus toxoid and tetanus immune globulin (TIG)
Administer tetanus immune globulin (TIG) as well as tetanus toxoid and call him the next day for the second dose of tetanus toxoid
Administer tetanus immune globulin (TIG) as well as tetanus toxoid and call him one month later for the second dose of tetanus toxoid

question: A lady presented to the outpatient department complaining of fatigue, shortness of breath, and a pale face. She got diagnosed with the case of malabsorption and megaloblastic anemia. Her reports show increased MCV. Antibodies against which of the following could be a reason for her anemia?

A male is sent by the court to estimate his age. His x-rays were done and it was found that all his epiphysis and diaphyseal lines of long bones were fused except the iliac crest which was still not fused. His age is:

A male patient comes to you for a follow-up visit. He has a history of thromboembolism for which he was started on a low-molecular-weight heparin (LMWH). However, he did not achieve adequate anticoagulation on LMWH. Therefore, he was started on warfarin. Which of the following was most likely used to monitor the status of anticoagulation?

A man has an enlarged prostate gland which is palpable on digital rectal examination. He is diagnosed with prostatic adenocarcinoma and presents with anemia and pancytopenia. MCV is normal. Which of the following is the type of anemia seen in this condition?

A man took anti-malarial prophylaxis before going to West Africa. Two to three weeks later he developed severe anemia along with hemoglobinuria. Which of the following is the correct statement regarding this condition?

answers.option: This disease is endemic in West Africa
This disease is transferred by mosquitoes
This disease develops from a spontanueous mutation

question: A mother brought her child to the outpatient department with a complaint of allergic rhinitis. Which of the following is most likely to be raised in the patient's blood?

A mother gave birth to a child at 39 weeks. It was a stillbirth and the baby showed ‘hydrops foetalis’. Upon Hb electrophoresis of the baby, Hb Barts was observed. Which of the following is true regarding this condition?

A mother, who had been on epilepsy drugs throughout her pregnancy, brings her 2-month-old child to the OPD with a complaint of sudden onset anal bleeding. What is the most likely reason for the bleeding?
A newborn feeds on cow milk 5 times a day. Which of the following can develop jaundice and pallor in this baby?

A nine-month-old baby presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of progressive pallor and failure to thrive for the past 4 months, his parents are first cousins. On examination, the baby is underweight at 5.6 kg, severely anemic, with mild jaundice, and hepatosplenomegaly. Complete blood count indicates Hb= 5.2 g/dl, MCV= 65 fl, Hb-f= 85%, and TLC and platelets are normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient complains of repeated instances of intense itching after a hot shower. Which condition is responsible for this?
A patient has presented with iron deficiency anemia and was prescribed treatment with iron supplements. Which single test would show early response to the treatment?

A patient is on antiplatelet therapy and is about to undergo surgery, His doctor advised him to discontinue the antiplatelet and wait at least one week before undergoing the surgery. Which of the following drugs is the patient most likely taking?
A patient is receiving heparin by continuous intravenous infusion. The doctor is most likely to ask the nurse to monitor which of the following symptoms?
A patient may present with hemolytic anemia because of genetic mutations in protein synthesis. What is the most common inherited disorder causing anemia in humans in this connection?

A patient presented to the outpatient department with pallor and cyanosis of extremities. The doctor suspected him of a case of hemolysis and ordered investigations. He had both direct and indirect coomb test positive but only at 4°C and not at 37°C. Which of the following is the type of immunoglobulin responsible?
A patient presented to the outpatient department with recurrent bleeding, infections, pallor, and jaundice. Which of the following would you find on bone marrow biopsy?

A patient presents to the outpatient department with jaundice and pallor. On her last visit, she was diagnosed with chronic anemia. A blood test is performed and it is observed that the reticulocyte count is reduced. Which of the following could be the reason for this patient's anemia?

answers.option: Viral infection of the bone marrow (aplastic crisis)

question: A patient presents to you with a history of sickle cell disease and recurrent vaso-occlusive crisis. Which of the following measures is the next best step to prevent a sickling crisis in the future?

answers.option: Ultrasound of carotid artery with timely transfusions

question: A patient undergoing treatment with heparin suddenly develops heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT). Which of the following routes of management should be used to treat the patient?
A person is brought to the emergency department with shortness of breath and syncope and is identified to have angina. Which of the following anticoagulants should be given to the patient?
A person with polycythemia vera will have which of the following?

answers.option: Cyanotic due to sluggish blood flow

question: A primigravida presents to the antenatal clinic at 10 weeks gestation for her first visit. Her blood group is B- and she has no history of abortions or miscarriages. What is the initial test that will be done?

A six-year-old boy presents to the emergency department with a history of fever for three days, lethargy for two days, and bleeding from the nose and rectum since morning. On examination, he has bruises and petechial rashes all over the body with increased heart rate low blood pressure, and poor peripheral pulses. CBC results show HB%: 9 g/dl, TLC: 29000/ul & platelets 15000/ul, aPT: 25 s and aPTT: 75 s. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A skull is found to have oval orbits, a sharp chin, an obtuse angle of the mandible, and smooth facial contours. The skull is more likely to belong to which of the following options?

A three-and-a-half-year-old male child was brought to the outpatient department with complaints of progressive pallor, lethargy, and easy fatigability. He is on cow's milk 5 times per day.
